devdoc.author: Jaan Smith

getGamesSize().author: Jaan Smith
getGamesSize().details: probably converted to a uint in a vinal build just to track new games, instead of tracking the existing array

newGame(address[],address[],uint256).author: Jaan Smith
newGame(address[],address[],uint256).details: too expensive to do in live, needs to be optimised or looked at for a cheaper option. (Costs 200k+ gas!)

params._blackPlayers: is an array of addresses representing the players for the black pieces
params._blockFactor: represents the amount of blocks that can pass before timing a team out
params._whitePlayers: is an array of addresses representing the players for the white pieces

returns.newContract: - the address of the new ChessGame contract owned by the msg.sender

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: A contract that initialises new ChessGames, giving users their own chess game

getGamesSize().notice: Returns the current size of the games variable

kill().notice: Destroys the contract, returning any potential funds to the owner

newGame(address[],address[],uint256).notice: Creates a new game, initialising new contracts for the chess game, and a new board state

toggleActive().notice: Flips the active state of the contract, active/inactive
